title: Rapid Fire
description: Rapid Fire is a Metasounds node that synthesizes physically modeled gunshot sound effects. It allows for flexible customization of gunfire sounds and intuitive controls that facilitate real-time sound generation.
longDescription: Rapid Fire is a node for the Unreal Engine MetaSounds environment, focusing on the procedural generation of gun shot sound effects. It allows for a range of realistic and customizable gun shot sounds, suitable for game developers and sound designers in action game development. The software uses a physical modeling algorithm to synthesize various gun types, and environmental influences, enabling flexible sound customization for multiple scenarios. It integrates smoothly with Unreal Engine’s audio system and features an intuitive interface for real-time sound manipulation. Rapid Fire aims to provide detailed, dynamic gun shot sounds that enhance the audio experience.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  Single Metasounds node with customization controls to emulate stages of gunfire: shell chirp, barrel noise, noise burst, and shock wave.
  • Integration with MetaSounds graph. No additional setups are required.
  • Generate sound effects while playing in graph or through blueprint.


Code Modules:

  •  RapidFire node - runtime


Number of Blueprints: 0

Number of C++ Classes: 1

Network Replicated: No

Supported Development Platforms: Win64, MacOS

Supported Target Build Platforms: Win64, MacOS

Documentation: Instruction Video

Example Project: RapidFire Test Project
